qas.question: How many genders does Catalan have?
What style of grammar does Catalan have?
What is used in Catalan as word endings that is different from other similar Romance languages?

context: Catalan has an <a2_0>inflectional<a2_0/> grammar, with <a0_0>two<a0_0/> genders (masculine, feminine), and two numbers (<a1_0>singular, plural<a1_0/>). Pronouns are also inflected for case, animacy[citation needed] and politeness, and can be combined in very complex ways. Verbs are split in several paradigms and are inflected for person, number, tense, aspect, mood, and gender. In terms of pronunciation, Catalan has many words ending in a wide variety of <a3_0>consonants<a3_0/> and some consonant clusters, in contrast with many other Romance languages.
